MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives.synopsis: In this scene, Alfira arrives unannounced at the player's camp. Depending on the grove, she either 1) asks the player if she can join their camp 2) be mad at the player for upsetting her in the grove and ask to spend the night (she got lost and needs shelter) or 3) if the player has missed the grove will ask the player to come help her friends the tieflings.In all instances, when the player and Alfira go to sleep, the player will awaken to find blood on their hands and Alfira's dead body next to her. They will have killed Alfira in their sleep. This is a scene specific to the Dark Urge custom origin.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives.how_to_trigger: Choose Dark Urge in CC. Start game. In Camp debug book, Queue Camp Night, keep scrolling until you get to NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfira. Click on it, close the menu and end the day.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives.synopsis: In this scene, a dragonborn bard, Quil Grootslang arrives unannounced at the player's camp.The player can tell them to leave or let them stay, but in either case in the next dialogue Quil will be dead.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives.how_to_trigger: Choose Dark Urge in CC. Start game. In Camp debug book,Kill Alfira (S_DEN_Bard).Queue Camp Night, keep scrolling until you get to NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfira. Click on it, close the menu and end the day.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup.synopsis: Jaheira and Minsc confront the Dark Urge about their recent revelation they are a Bhaalspawn. Depending on how much the player has given into Bhaal, they are either more sympathetic, or almost hostile. But either way, they are supportive and want to use their knowledge of fighting alongside Bhaalspawn in the past to convince you that you can do good

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_90.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player recognises her

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_139.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_139.text: Alfira! How did you find your way here? It's very dangerous.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_24.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_24.text: Alfira! What are you doing out here?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_32.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_32.text: I'm sorry for barging in like this, but I had to come find you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_41.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_41.text: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard Lihala was.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_41.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_130.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_130.text: I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people - as you've helped me.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_135.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_135.text: Are you sure? I lead a dangerous life.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_115.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_115.text: I've been running since Elturel - and when we finally arrived in the grove, we found danger there, too.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_47.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_47.text: Unless I hide away from the world, I can't avoid it. So I'd rather face it head on - with you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_82.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_82.text: You managed to sneak through the goblin camp - you'll be very useful.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_164.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_164.text: Really? Just like that? Oh, thank you - thank you so much.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_164.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_106.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_106.text: You may join me - I'd love to have you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_20.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_20.text: You can stay - for now. Let's see how you fare.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_99.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_99.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_21.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_21.text: But I can fight! I won't hold you back, I swear it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_49.speaker: Karlach
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_49.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_2.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_2.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_88.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_88.text: Yes! Thank you - you won't regret it!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_88.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_70.speaker: Karlach
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_70.text: Very good! Break out that lute, bard - I'm in the mood for a song.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_124.speaker: Lae'zel
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_124.text: Mm. Just keep it quiet, hear?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_113.speaker: Wyll
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_113.text: Ease your worries, warm your hands. We owe you that much.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_67.speaker: Shadowheart
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_67.text: Safer to keep her here than blundering around by herself - wouldn't want her accidentally leading the wrong sort of attention to us.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_16.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_16.text: I won't let you down - I promise.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_16.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_155.speaker: Astarion
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_155.text: Really? Just like that? All right, but if she reaches for that lute, it's firewood.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_58.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_58.text: I just wanted to hear you beg a little - you can join me.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_103.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_103.text: Hah! Then well played, because I was moments away from getting on my knees.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_103.context: NodeContext: joking back with the player - big smile

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_3.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_3.text: Joking aside, thank you. You won't regret this - I promise.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_3.context: NodeContext: delighted, over the moon to be joining

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_8.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_8.text: You can stay for the night, but I want you gone by morning.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_122.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_122.context: NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_79.speaker: Lae'zel
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_79.text: Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_104.speaker: Wyll
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_104.text: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_104.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_120.speaker: Shadowheart
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_120.text: She may not be much of an asset, but I doubt she'll be a hindrance. Let her stay.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_127.speaker: Gale
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_127.text: Oh, come on, let her stay - we have room to spare.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_151.speaker: Astarion
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_151.text: As long as she doesn't start serenading me. I've had enough of bad poets singing of my looks.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_142.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_142.text: It's safer for you at the grove.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_61.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_61.text: True. But I'm a bard, remember? I want to do more than sing about other people's adventures.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_157.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_157.text: I want to make my own stories. And I can't think of anyone else I'd rather share that with.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_117.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_117.text: No - I have no time for weaklings.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_54.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_54.text: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard my teacher was.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_54.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_19.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_19.text: Remind me who you are, again?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_140.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_140.text: Oh. We met in the grove? You helped me finish my song - the Weeping Dawn?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_140.context: NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_101.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_101.text: Oh. We met in the grove? I heard what you did - how much you helped us.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_101.context: NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it. Sincere in second half

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_57.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_57.text: Give me one reason not to kill you right now.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_119.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_119.text: Whoa - whoa! I'm here because of you!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_119.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_31.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_31.text: I'm so glad I found - wait, it's me!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_85.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_85.text: I'm so glad I found - wait!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found a camp (her and the player have never met) Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_133.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_133.text: My name is Alfira - I'm a bard. I mean no harm!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_107.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_107.text: What are you doing in the middle of the goblin camp? It's very dangerous.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_147.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_147.text: What are you doing here? It's dangerous.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_143.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_143.text: Don't sneak up on people like that.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_134.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_134.text: I'm sorry. I just saw your fire and ran towards it. I need your help.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_0.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_0.text: I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_76.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_76.text: Give me one reason not to kill you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_51.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_51.text: I need your help! I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_51.context: NodeContext: scared, player is on the verge of attacking her

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_74.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_74.text: *Her voice is steady - her gaze unflinching. She's telling the truth.*

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_168.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_168.text: You can clearly handle yourself in a fight. And we, well, we're not exactly warriors.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_105.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_105.text: The druids are threatening to kick us out, but goblins swarm the roads. If we leave, we're dead. If we stay, we're dead.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_30.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_30.text: It's pure luck I got this far. I'm, well, exhausted.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_71.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_71.text: Let me stay the night, and I'll take you to the grove in the morning. Please.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_34.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_34.text: You can stay then night, but then you leave. Alone.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_128.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_128.text: But my friends, all of us, we'll die without help!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_81.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_81.text: Really? Oh, I'm so relieved. Everyone is going to be so happy to see you - I know it!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_65.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_65.text: Goodnight, and thank you. I mean it.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_65.context: NodeContext: small tired smile - she finally sees hope

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_35.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_35.text: All right, all right! I just... I was sure you would help.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_163.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_163.text: I'll be gone by first light. Good night.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_159.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_159.text: I changed my mind - get out. Now.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_29.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_29.text: All right... all right. I'll find someone else. I'm sure.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_102.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_102.text: What exactly do you want me to do?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_132.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_132.text: Things between us and the druids are tense. If you could mediate - maybe convince them to let us stay, that would be a big help.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_132.context: NodeContext: scared, just trying to think of anything to help her friends

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_93.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_93.text: And if that doesn't work, well, we'll need protection on the road.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_123.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_123.text: My services come at a price - give me everything you have.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_169.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_169.text: But... fine. Here. That's all I have.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_169.context: NodeContext: player has asked for money. Sad, but willing. This is her life savings

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_43.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_43.text: Unfortunately, I'm exhausted. If I take you to the grove now, I'll get lost - I know it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_92.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_92.text: I'll grab a few winks, and then I'll lead you there first thing in the morning. Thank you - I'm glad I found you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_92.context: NodeContext: trying to rally herself and make a plan

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_114.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_114.text: I'm so glad I found - wait!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_84.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_84.text: I'm Alfira - a bard from the grove. I don't mean any harm!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_145.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_145.text: You wandered through the goblin camp? You must really want to meet me.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_36.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_36.text: Hah. I know who you are - how could I not? You're all anyone in the grove talks about.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_36.context: NodeContext: small laugh at the beginning as player has introduced themselves. She's travelled all this way just to find them.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_44.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_44.text: That's why I'm here. When I'd heard what you'd done - it inspired me. Made me feel brave again.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_44.context: NodeContext: Gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_158.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_158.text: I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people, as you've helped us.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_68.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_68.text: Is something wrong? Are the tieflings all right?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_38.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_38.text: Oh, yes! Everything is fine - thanks to you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_38.context: NodeContext: touched the player was worried

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_86.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_86.text: Wait - wait! I'm not your enemy, quite the opposite, in fact!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_86.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_161.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_161.text: You're all anyone talks about in the grove. Hearing all you've done inspired me.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_4.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves out of combat ready stanceNodeContext: unhappy to see player

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_5.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_5.text: How in the Hells did you get here?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_94.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_94.text: Gods, this is the last thing I need.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_94.context: NodeContext: looking away, trying not to get upset. The player is the person she was trying to get away from.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_46.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_46.text: Look, after you broke my lute, I was... in a bad way.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_46.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_25.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_25.text: Look, I did as you said - I quit being a bard. You were right - I wasn't any good. But it... left me in a bad way.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_25.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_1.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_1.text: I couldn't stay in the grove with the others - just waiting to die. So I left.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_1.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_53.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_53.text: I'm not going to say it's fine, because it's not. But thank you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_53.context: NodeContext: player has apologised and while alfira isn't ready to accept it, she really appreciates it. A small step towards rebuilding her trust.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_52.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_52.text: Look, I'm here because I saw your fire and hoped for a safe place to rest. Would you mind if I stayed her tonight?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_52.context: NodeContext: clearly exchuated, today has been a lot.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_72.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_72.text: You managed to sneak through enemy grounds - you'd be useful in the party.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_27.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_27.text: Why don't you join me? I'll keep you safe.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_69.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_69.text: Sorry, I don't mean to sound ungrateful, I'm just exhausted. Why don't we talk about it in the morning?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_69.context: NodeContext: catches herself - appreciates the offer but doesn't have the energy to think about it much

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_109.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_109.text: But it... doesn't sound like such a bad idea. Goodnight, and thank you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_109.context: NodeContext: small gentle smile, hinting that alfira could potentially join the player in the morning (she doesn't, cause the player kills her, but still)

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_78.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_78.text: You? No - I don't think you will.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_78.context: NodeContext: player has asked her to join them, alfira has zero time for this.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_80.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_80.text: I don't have the energy for this. I'm going to bed. Don't worry - I'll be gone by first light.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_152.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_152.text: Stay out of my way and be gone in the morning.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_125.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_125.text: Goodnight and... thank you for letting me stay.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_125.context: NodeContext: but still, because she's lovely, feels the need to say thank you. Very begrudging thank you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_9.speaker: Karlach
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_9.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_156.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_156.text: Please - it's dark and I'm... I'm afraid. Just one night - I beg of you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_156.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_87.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_87.context: NodeContext: reliebed she can stay. Plans to leave in the morning and never speak to the player again.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_17.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_17.text: Sleep by the latrine, and don't say a word to me.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_7.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_7.context: NodeContext: player is being a dick to her - telling her to sleep by the toilet. She agrees, upset and bitter.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_48.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_48.text: I thought you many things, but cruel? That's a first.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_48.context: NodeContext: disgusted by player - she asked for help and been turned away very cruelly

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_73.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_73.text: If the gods have any sense of justice, we won't meet again.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_15.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_15.context: NodeContext: player has readied themselves to attack her. Hands up - as if warding the player away - scared and shocked.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_96.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_96.text: Gods. You really are a bastard, you know that?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_96.context: NodeContext: furious as she turns to leave

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_11.speaker: Lae'zel
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_11.text: Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_39.speaker: Wyll
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_39.text: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_39.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_141.speaker: Shadowheart
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_141.text: Oh don't be such a killjoy. What's the worst that could happen?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_50.speaker: Gale
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_50.text: We have room at the campfire yet - let the girl stay. I wouldn't want it said that I am any less than a perfect gentleman.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_98.speaker: Astarion
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_98.text: I'd be careful, little waif, we don't all play nicely.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_83.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_83.context: NodeContext: player has tried to apologise and alfira has ZERO time for it

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_66.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_66.text: I'm only here out of necessity. I saw your fire in the dark, and I'm, well, exhausted. I need somewhere safe to rest.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_66.context: NodeContext: business-like - just wants to sleep, leave, and never set eyes on the player again

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_12.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_12.text: Waterdeep... Neverwinter. I don't know. The farther the better.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_12.context: NodeContext: sad - just wants to get away

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_22.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_22.text: I saw your fire and I hoped for a safe place to rest...
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_22.context: NodeContext: feeling a bit awkward - she doesn't want to be here but she desperately needs somewhere to rest (player will have the option to let her stay after this line)

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_129.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_129.text: So you ran like a coward? Good to know.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_95.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_95.text: Why did I bother trying to explain myself? I've met steaming piles of excrement more pleasant than you.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_138.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_138.text: That much of a fool, you got lost in the goblin camp?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_75.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_75.text: You know what it means, you lute-breaking arsehole.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_59.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_59.text: It means I did as you said - I quit being a bard. I wasn't any good, remember?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_108.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_108.text: I should kill you for barging in here.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_60.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_60.text: That would only be the second-worst thing you've done to me - you lute breaking arsehole.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_6.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_6.text: First you convince me to quit being a bard, then you threaten to kill me? Charming as ever.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_40.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_40.text: Argh. This is the last thing I need. Look - you left me... in a bad way.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_40.context: NodeContext: trying to regin in her emotions and just give the facts

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_131.speaker: Alfira
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_131.text: Please, stay your blade! I mean no - oh.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_AlfiraArrives_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: She's lost in the dark and just walked into what she thinks is a stranger's camp - looking for shelter. The 'oh' is because she recognises the player.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_0.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_0.text: What kind of music do you write?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_37.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_37.text: I've prepared a dense manuscript of new love-chants, to be throat-sung in Tymanther style.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_27.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_27.text: I know we must marry into whichever clan suits our own. And I know we're not allowed to let love drive us,

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_40.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_40.text: But I've never even been kissed and I can't stop myself from dreaming.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_14.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_14.text: I don't think most of us stop hoping, ever, really. Not even when duty stamps us down.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_15.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_15.text: And that's what the songbook's about. Lost lost, lingering love, never acted on. Never spoken.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_49.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_49.text: I don't think I've ever even been to our homeland... I know nothing of our clans.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_52.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_52.text: So you ran away from home?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_74.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_74.text: My clan-name has been struck. I named myself anew after a long-dead poet.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_16.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_16.text: Perhaps. But I want to capture this feeling, while it still strikes hot.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_87.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_87.text: You probably don't know, but the dragonborn clans arrange their children's marital unions. Love is considered irrelevant to egg-duty.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_26.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_26.text: Why were you travelling on the road, in the middle of the night?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_4.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_4.text: I've been given a great chance. My song-score: Affairs in Ancient Abeir: Songs of Draconic Love is due to be published in the Gate!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_23.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_23.text: I'm in a big big rush, though. I fear that if I don't get there in the next few days they're gonna print some kobold bone-flute instrumentals instead.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_63.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_63.text: How do you write love songs, if you've never found love yourself?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_81.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_81.text: Is there someone who you think you might love? Come on, I won't tell.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_86.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_86.text: Astarion might be the most perfect being to ever walk the day.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_34.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_34.text: Mock me as you will, but I have a thing for Gale.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_77.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_77.text: I'll never meet another like Lae'zel, that's for sure.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_22.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_22.text: Wyll is such a gentleman, I imagine he'd make an even better partner.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_10.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_10.text: Karlach seems like she has so much love to give, if she found the right person.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_57.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_57.text: And have you said so? Do they know even one little bit of how you really feel?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_33.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_33.text: I'll tell them when I'm sure they'll say it back.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_20.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_20.text: No, and I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to tell them.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_6.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_6.text: I think they hardly know I exist.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_31.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_31.text: There's a special feeling to having love all to yourself, don't you think? For no one to know.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_8.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_8.text: I grew up smiling about my little secrets to myself. I would have been laughed at if I admitted to anyone how I felt. It is not our kind's way.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_18.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_18.text: But I have my whole life ahead of me... Things will be different now I'm on the Sword Coast. I can't wait for what is coming next!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_24.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_24.text: I've been honest enough, so far.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_83.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_83.text: My mind and loins are captive to thoughts of Halsin.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_43.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_43.text: I met the most amazing, bewildering Drow the other day...

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_5.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_5.text: My head is on my shoulders, not in the clouds.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_54.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_54.text: Well, your life is poorer for it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_48.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_48.text: Will you sing a draconic song for me?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_41.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_41.text: Oh my! Are you sure? Are you really sure!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_61.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_61.text: What's the worst that could happen?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_19.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_19.text: Spoken like someone who's never heard a dragonborn throatsong.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_9.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_9.text: This one, Sky-Swain  is about what it might feel like to mate in the air, in the age where wings were yet with us.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_9.context: NodeContext: Intake of breath at the end of it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_78.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_78.context: NodeContext: As dischordant and unpleasant to listen to as one can imagine

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_65.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_65.context: NodeContext: Like clawing nails down a chalkboard

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_64.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_64.text: Ah, the true language of love.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_30.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_30.text: That's quite enough culture for one evening!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_58.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_58.text: Oh, there are sixty nine more verses, I'm only just beginning!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: As it ends, fade out to allow the player to escape

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_80.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_80.text: Well, I'm sure it's of anthropological interest to someone.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_70.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_70.text: Erm, on second thoughts, let's go to sleep.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_17.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_17.text: Are you any good in a fight?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_75.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_75.text: Pfft. It's a miracle I'm still alive!

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_66.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_66.text: Hark! Hark! A camp, and, Oghma-willing, some friendly faces.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_2.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_2.text: Well met. Goblins roughed me up and stole my hose when they heard me singing Hatchling Love.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_59.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_59.text: You wouldn't have half a bedroll for a lost minstrel, would you? I can pay for my board with music, if you care for it?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_39.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_39.text: 'Sides, it's hardly ever I meet another with scales as lovely as mine. You're the kind of gorgeous I dreamed of nesting with as a girl.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_76.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_76.text: Quil Grootslang, soon to be published in the songbook Affairs in Ancient Abeir: Songs of Draconic Love. If I make it to Baldur's Gate with my manuscript, that is.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_55.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_55.text: It's dangerous out there to be travelling on your own...

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_44.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_44.text: Sigh. I know. It's not the first time I've been robbed, I am only glad I didn't get hurt.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_46.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_46.text: Our hearth is open, and there is safety beside it.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_68.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_68.text: I'll just stay one night, promise, then I'll be gone. I know I'm ice-blood, but I get cold so fast, I need to be by the fire.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_29.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_29.text: You're very far from our people's home.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_11.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_11.text: Well, in all honesty, I ran from Tymanther to avoid my egg-duty.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_45.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_45.text: Hardly a soul on the Sword Coast has heard our kind's love chants. I've made a fair bit of coin performing them.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_42.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_42.text: Although half the time it's for some Society of Brilliance twat with two left feet writing a book about us.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_67.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_67.text: You can't stay - I have no time for weaklings.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_7.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_7.text: But- agh, I have worked for years on my music, I just have to bring my songbook safely to Baldur's Gate.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_13.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_13.text: I can't risk another night in the open - the goblins might steal my manuscript next time. Surprised they didn't take it when they lifted my poulaines.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_32.speaker: Lae'zel
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_32.text: Invite her in, cast her out. I see no difference either way.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_21.speaker: Karlach
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_21.text: Never say no to a bard. They'll write all sorts of mean shit about you.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_21.context: NodeContext: with a subtext of 'duh', then with a soft kindness toward Alfira, who she's met before.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_1.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_1.text: Please, oh, please. It would mean so much to me.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_1.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_38.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_38.text: Yes! Thank you - I'll write your name in the dedication!
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_38.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_12.speaker: Player
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_12.text: Stay at the edge of the camp, and stay quiet.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_50.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_50.text: Ah, you're a fearsome one! Fine by me, I'll get some shut-eye. Although I do sometimes whistle when I snore...

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_71.speaker: Quil Grootslang
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_71.text: Fine... if I must... but there's trouble out there, and I don't have so much as a butterknife on me.
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_71.context: NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_51.speaker: Wyll
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_51.text: Oh, but she seems such a delight! Let her stay, at least for the night.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_69.speaker: Shadowheart
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_69.text: Oh, let her stay. What's the worst that could happen?

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_72.speaker: Gale
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_72.text: She hardly seems a danger to us. Let the girl stay, if she's desperate enough to think our troupe good company.

MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_84.speaker: Astarion
MurderOfAlfira_CFM_BardBackupArrives_84.text: Gods, let her stay if she shuts the hells up.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_54.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_54.text: *The sleeping blood-beast within claws and scratches at your resting mind. You are, as ever, mere hairs away from its grasp.*

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_84.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_84.text: *Another watches your body, while it is possessed by the night. You do not dream alone.*
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player opening their eyes, and a figure standing over them about a pace away - Jaheira. The player sits up.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_9.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_9.text: I think I can guess. Visions of blood on your hands. The blood in your veins, perhaps.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_2.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_2.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_95.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_95.text: You have not confessed it all, I think. There is something in the air tonight - the scent of a terrible and familiar power.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_120.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_120.text: So the game is up at last.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_8.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_8.text: There is one last piece I've been toying with. A terrible and familiar power I've sensed around you for some time.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_58.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_58.text: And so I come to ask: what did it take for you to earn that Slayer-skin you hide so well?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_122.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_122.text: I've slept beside a Bhaalspawn before. I know the signs - the dreams, the urges... the power.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_118.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_51.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_51.text: If I must lie awake, then so must you - only fair, considering that you are the reason.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_73.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_73.text: I've been sensing something, you see. A formless but familiar dread, which I have only now been able to put a name to.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_135.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_135.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_153.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_153.text: You have not confessed it all, I think.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_29.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_29.text: So the game is up at last.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_129.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_129.text: Almost. There is but one piece left to play.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_59.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_59.text: *The ranger's thoughts flit through your own, searching, probing for something specific. Until he finds...*
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc and the player mind-melding

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_107.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_107.text: There we have our answer. But we might as well hear it from you.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_68.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_68.text: So - what did it take to earn that new Slayer-skin of yours?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_4.text: This power will save the world from the Absolute. The price doesn't matter.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_82.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_82.text: I have spent my life fighting your father in whatever form he chose to take. By rights, I should cut you down here.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_22.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_22.text: But that would be a mercy. One you have not earned.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_27.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_27.text: You are twice-tainted, yes. But whatever you have done - you might yet serve the good.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing, Jaheira sighs and shethes her weapons. She steps back [to stand beside Minsc if he's present], giving the player room to stand.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_25.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_25.text: What? Evil cannot serve good, Jaheira. That is why it is evil.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_121.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_121.text: You know better than that, Stone Lord. We found the good in you - and we found it in another Bhaalspawn, once before.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_46.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_46.text: Whatever its source, the Slayer form is a weapon like any other. And if you mean to master it, I know where you must go.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_149.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_149.text: To face the other of your kind - Orin. So long as the other lives, neither of you can claim your full power.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_143.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_143.text: Don't patronise me. I can do without your guidance.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_14.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_14.text: It is not guidance I offer, but a leash. We will help you to control yourself - until you can free yourself of these urges, and use the Slayer form freely.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_63.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_63.text: The burden of your blood is yours to carry, but you need not carry it alone.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_113.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_113.text: *A spike of rage, quickly muffled - Minsc's mind still lingers near your own, and he does not like what is coming to pass.*

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_26.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_26.text: What if I slip out of control again? You will kill me?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_139.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_139.text: You will be protected. Even from yourself.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_77.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_77.text: Come on, let's go back to sleep.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_28.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_28.text: You first. I find that sleep escapes me, so I might as well take the watch.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_100.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_100.text: Or perhaps I will take you to my Father directly - as trophies.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_125.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_125.text: No need for such dramatics. I will go with eyes wide open - and the hope that I know you a little better than you know yourself.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_111.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_111.text: For now, rest. Sleep escapes me, so I might as well take the watch.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_48.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_48.text: As will I. Jaheira tells me a debt is owed - even if my heart and hamster do not understand it.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_7.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_7.text: *You rest with the knowledge that you are being watched over. Or indeed, guarded.*

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_145.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pulling out from camp, player falling to sleep with Jaheira / and Minsc sitting down beside them.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_87.text: Poke at Minsc's mind to stoke his rage.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_85.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_85.text: *A single prod is enough to send his fury into a twisted spiral, wrapping around you then storming over to Jaheira.*

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_12.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jerking his head furiously, mind-meld dissipating

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_78.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_78.text: Jaheira, they tried to make me... I almost...

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_109.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_109.text: *For a moment, the briefest, weakest moment, Jaheira appears as she truly is. Simply an old woman, uncertain and afraid.*
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taking a step back in shock

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_98.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_98.text: Perhaps I was too swift to put up my blades. But we will not play into your father's hands this night.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_52.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_52.text: As you wish, then. We take our leave. I hope you have mastered yourself, when next we meet. If not, we will do what we must.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira backs away and leaves, Minsc trailing behind.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_43.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_43.text: If there is still good in you - find it quickly, says Boo. Or the next time we meet, you will know my rage.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_148.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_148.text: And what will become of me, if I beat her?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_128.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_128.text: Show daddy dear that you alone choose your fate. You are a child of Bhaal - but that need not be all that you are.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_96.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_96.text: And when you stand against him, you will not stand alone.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_90.text: I intend to become Bhaal's Chosen. So bow, or die.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_130.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_130.text: I am truly bored of that phrase.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_66.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_66.text: Cast yourself into the dark if you wish. I mean to be there to pull you back - by the hand, or the scruff.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_86.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_86.text: You will answer for this, fiend. And it will be an answer of the screaming sort.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_101.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding hand up to Minsc, but never taking eyes off player.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_83.text: Innocent blood. As innocent as my own: I have no control over when my body kills.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_117.text: Bathing in my dearest friend's gore.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_17.text: Isobel was my doing... the rest of Last Light was an accident.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_19.text: I stole every little life in Last Light.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_45.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_33.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_33.text: Then we shall make this swift.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_0.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_0.text: For all the gifts Bhaal's children inherit - a peaceful night's sleep is not among them.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira steps forward, and we see that she's holding her scimitars, blades bared.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_65.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_65.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_89.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_89.text: I think you are still dreaming if you see a dagger before you. She has a sword - two of them, in fact.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_53.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_53.text: The dreams alone do not concern me. It is what waking deeds they might inspire.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_115.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_115.text: Are you truly your own master? What is it you feel, when father's dreams come calling?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_36.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_36.text: My birthright, in all its vile glory.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_47.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_47.text: That birthright may well bring you to a bloody end. How many should I allow to go with you?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_62.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_62.text: Helpless. Like I can deny him nothing.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_55.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_55.text: Then would you call it mercy, if the next night I never let you wake?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_137.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_137.text: It's sickening. I never asked for this power, and hope to be rid of it.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_152.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_152.text: There is one certain way. I hold it in my hand.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_20.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_20.text: I don't owe you answers, especially not at sword-point.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_34.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_34.text: And what is it I owe? Should I allow some horror to be born anew, when I could end it here and now?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_24.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_24.text: This is your father's true legacy. Not his children - but the fear they plant in us. The savagery it blossoms into.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_114.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_114.text: But you have reminded us that when evil calls, we might stop our ears with virtuous cotton. Haven't they, Jaheira?
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_114.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc walks to stand behind Jaheira.
IF DOABLE - he clasps her shoulder, as if reminding her.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_13.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_13.text: In another time - with another of your kind - we found a better way. I would dearly like to find it again.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing, Jaheira sighs and shethes her weapons. She steps back [to stand beside Minsc if he's present], giving the player room to stand.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_133.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_133.text: Tell me what I must do.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_6.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_6.text: Well, you cannot understand Boo's wisdom. So I suppose we must listen to Jaheira instead.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_102.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_102.text: My path is mine alone to choose.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_56.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_56.text: But not yours alone to walk.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_91.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_91.text: Whatever path you choose, I fear it will lead you to the same point. The same enemy.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_72.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_72.text: And if I embrace Father's power? Grant unto him my love?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_146.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_146.text: It would be like swinging a sword by the wrong side. Painful - but it can be effective, too.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_88.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_88.text: You would not be the first to turn the taint in your blood to your advantage. But there are barriers a Bhaalspawn must overcome, first.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_136.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_136.text: Those of your kind. Orin - I am sure you already know that so long as she lives, she will never stop hunting you.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_64.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_64.text: It might be that you have to turn and face her - you cannot change that. All you can choose is how you meet her: as another bloodied child of Bhaal, or as yourself.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_69.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_69.text: And for this, you will need Boo. He has tasted Bhaalspawn flesh before - and he would not mind another bite.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_67.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_67.text: For now, take what rest you can - we will watch over you this night.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_30.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_30.text: To watch over me - or to protect against me?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_40.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_40.text: I suppose you'll have your answer when you wake in the morning.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_70.text: How do I know you won't kill me?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_92.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_92.text: Are we so faithless? As you wish - while we watch over you, Boo shall be watching over us.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_147.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_147.text: *No more dreams await you in sleep this night. Only the warm knowledge that, indeed - you are not alone.*

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_93.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_93.text: All I can offer is the promise that, should you choose to do so, you will not meet her alone.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_79.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_79.text: For now, take what rest you can - I will watch over you this night.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_21.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_21.text: Do not thank us, friend. It is not as if we didn't consider killing you instead.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_104.text: I won't sleep again. Tell me something of the old days, since they're on your mind.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_10.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_10.text: I don't think I have any -

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_94.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_94.text: Have you ever fought with a talking sword?

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_103.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera begins to pull out and voices fade as they continue talking into the night.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_126.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_126.text: Yes! A mighty blade, but a mouthy one, too. I wonder what happened to it.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_76.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_76.text: I believe it went over a cliff-edge, buried in an ogre's backside. And it was still talking...

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_16.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_16.text: Your past is not my future.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_42.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_42.text: Leave the future for hathrans and hamsters to divine. We speak only of this moment.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_105.text: 'A better way?' It's too late. My cruel deeds cannot be undone.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_144.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_144.text: You are what you are, child of Bhaal. But that need not be all that you are.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_38.text: Kill me then, coward. I dare you to try.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_134.speaker: Jaheira
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_134.text: Ever the Bhaalspawn's lot. To bring death, or wait for it to find them.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_138.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_138.text: So the game is up at last.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_155.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_155.text: No game. A serious matter, to rouse Boo from his beauty sleep.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_106.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_106.text: Boo remembers the scent of Bhaalspawn. Like rot on the tongue - meaning no offence.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_116.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_116.text: She is worrying. Which worries me. Which worries Boo. Which ought to worry you.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_18.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_112.speaker: Minsc
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_112.text: We do not loom, friend. We tread soft and sure as hunting hamsters.
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_141.speaker: Narrator
CFM_BloodweddingFollowup_141.text: *Tonight's troubled rest is, as ever, overwhelmed by your killing fate. You dangle above a dark precipice, one move away from falling.*
